review.title: Dirtiness everywhere
review.reviewText: The hotel staff could be ok but the restaurant staff doesn't care at all. The building is old and it looks like lacks of maintenance, old furniture, dirty rooms, dirty beddings old and stinky bathrooms, the disgusting smell is quite strong. I would not go again.

review.title: Nice Hotel, good location in Centro Historico
review.reviewText:
This is a clean, comfortable hotel in the Centro Historico.  The room was large, clean and comfortable.  The bathroom could use an update, and the shower pressure was weak.  There is no a/c, but good air circulation from windows in bedroom and bathroom.  Our room was on the North side of the building, which was comfortable temperature wise..  They were also experiencing some problems with elevators acting up,  Hotel restaurant has a typical Mexican breakfast buffet, which was good and reasonably priced.  

If you want a 5 star hotel, this isn't for you.  If you want clean comfortable accommodation as a base for walking/touring, give it a try
review.positiveRemarks:
good location, for walking/exploring. 
clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms would benefit from an update
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Zocalo, and Centro Historico.  Zona Rosa is about 3.4 km, Chapultapec Castle about 5km.

review.title: Gets the job done
review.reviewText: It is a basics hotel.  When in Mexico city all you need is a place to sleep and shower.  This hotel gets the job done.  Love their shower!!! Its very wide water works excellent.  Beds are hard enough, remember that you dont want soft beds when you really want to rest...Location is great, half a block from Alameda central, and about 150 yards from Palacio de Bellas Artes and Historic District.  If you like fancy hotels, then this is not for you...but if you are a traveler that loves to explore and visit great cities, then you will be pleased...
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location....oh and shower, and bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Its a little outdated, but gets job done.

review.title: Nice hotel staff
review.reviewText: hotel is quiet but outside there are city cleaning trucks that park with engine on almost all nights so you can hear that noise.
review.locationRemarks: its is near many historic places

review.title: Do not trust the pictures
review.reviewText: The hotel looks completely different than the pictures. I couldn't believe it was the same hotel. The bathrooms smelled terribly and the bed was extremely uncomfortable.

review.title: I was surprised in a bad way.
review.reviewText: I thought this hotel could be a bit better. Floor was dirty, bathroom looked very old.

review.title: no fans
review.reviewText: room full of mosqitos with window open,too hot closed.it took sometime for  me to buy a fan .then it was much better.
review.negativeRemarks: ceiling fans or go buy a small one ,the electrical shops  are very close by. 2500 pesos

review.title: I wouldn't go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel smells terrible and it is very dirty. The room's carpet was full of dirt. The internet was not working all the time neither the cable. The room is dark and cold, and the bathroom smells filthy. Everytime  that we  asked  for towells the stuff ignored us.

review.title: Close to many attractions
review.reviewText: The room was clean and spacious. The shower was terrible with the taps being below the knees and dirt coming out of the walls when you turn the shower on. Bell boy was quite annoying.

review.title: Closeby hotel to tourist spots.
review.reviewText: Hotel is worth what you pay for. The only downside is that eventhough it'a a smoke free location it seems it wasn't that way in the past. There's a heavy cigarette smell in the hotel's hallways and a bit lighter in the rooms. At the end of the day what you need the room is to rest a couple of hours in order to continue touring, so the location fullfills that purpose. Very kind staff. Hotel is located on a very centric and secure area. Recommended.

review.title: a lot place's to visit,near
review.reviewText: nothing about my room reservation,,, i did, reservation for, two rooms, with a one king size bed,,,, each one, for 4 adults,,,, they give me a two rooms, wirh two small beds....when i went to ask at the front desk, they told me the. nobody know nothing about it,,,,,,.....one room was dirty,......
review.positiveRemarks: taxi services is fast and nice driver's......restaurant is really bad....
review.locationRemarks: is really nice,, a lot place;s ,,restaurant's, shopping, center's, park;s,,,,,,store,,,,,near

review.title: can find better for the price
review.reviewText: place was pretty dirty and i feel a bit of a rip off.
review.locationRemarks: pretty good location in centro historico

review.title: OK hotel well located
review.reviewText: The price match the hotel, it's a good place for a couple nights
review.locationRemarks: Safety place half block from Alameda, so it has a great location

review.title: Nice hotel close to the downtown
review.reviewText:
I really liked the location of the hotel, close to bellas artes, zocalo and reforma.
Hot water runs better in the morning, after 3pm takes like 10 minutes to get hot.

review.title: terrible place. What a dump!
review.reviewText: Expedia shouldn't put this hotel on the website . It hurt the reputation of Expedia too
review.negativeRemarks: Destroy it and build a new one

review.title: Sorry but would not recommend for a family
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful. Room service was fast. Cleanliness of the room was horrible. We arrived at hotel and room was decent looking. No air conditioning and it was 90+F outside. Uncovered blankets & found hair on sheets & pillows. Bedcover had a stain on & smelled horrible. I called receptionist desk & they immediately brought clean sheets to us. They also brought a fan. Beds were very firm. Sorrt but I will not be staying there on my next trip to Mexico city. Also wifi only worked in the lobby. No wifi in the room

review.title: Not Recommended!
review.reviewText: This place is a dump. For 20 dollars more per night we moved to another hotel of a major Mexican chain. Bed frames and mattresses where disgusting , that's why we chose to move. We didn't even spend one night here. I've stayed at other 1 and 2 star hotels but they have to be clean. This place was old , dirty, and run down. You get what u pay for.

review.title: it is not clean
review.reviewText:
it is not clean. there is footprint on the pillow.
the location is the only advantage.

review.title: If you just need a place to sleep this is it
review.reviewText: I would reccomend this hotel for a 1-2 night stay. Everything is ok especially with the rates you can find through Expedia. Dont expect anything else than a good part of the city to sleep and great starting point to any activity in Mexico City. You wont have much time to be at a hotel if your in DF anyway. I ended ordering a Pastrami sandwhich from their restaurant one night that was delicious.
review.positiveRemarks: Near to plenty of attractions within walking distance
review.negativeRemarks: Bad smell throughout the floors and sometimes in the room

review.title: OK hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
OK place in a great location. There was 4 groups of boy and girls soccer teams so it was crowed but they handle it fine.
At first they gave me a 3 single beds room when we've asked 1-kingsize or something, but after the complain the gave us a better room (the only one left apparently)
review.negativeRemarks: They didn't have the key for the room, they said the last guest never return it, they should change to card-keys
review.locationRemarks: Next to Alameda Park, safe zone, 7-eleven at the corner, close walk to coffee shops and dinner places

review.title: Safe
review.reviewText: This hotel is not in the best of neighborhoods but its safe and clean and near the historical district and the nice park on Jaurez (although at this time its closed for remodeling). I also like the Hotel San Francisco in Toluca.
review.locationRemarks: It is near the historical district and the nice park on Jaurez (although at this time its closed for remodeling).

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: Only a good location. Internet did not work, support - forget about it . Cleanliness and quality of the room leaves much to be desired.

review.title: Good neighborhood
review.reviewText: This Hotel is nice for the price. Although it didn't have Ac it was realitively cool for the time of year that we visited, which was in June. The staff was friendly. and we wre in walking distance of lots resterants and musems.

review.title: For a cheap, basic option in the Centro Historico, it's fine
review.reviewText: You wouldn't stay at this hotel if you want a lovely hotel experience. You would only stay here if you're looking for a cheap, basic option in a decent location near to the sights of the Centro Historico - just a place to sleep at night - not a place to lounge around in. It is a bit old and run-down, but the rooms are clean enough, and the price was right on Expedia. It's a place to lay your head, but not much else.

review.title: Cheap but you get what you pay for.
review.reviewText:
When I moved into my room, the internet was not available in that room. I was moved to another room but the internet was not much better. Three of the days, the internet stopped working completely. If you need internet access, this is not the hotel to stay at.

There building is old and there is a sewer smell that comes up from the drain in the bathrooms.

If you just need a place to sleep, this will be fine.

review.title: NO GOOD HOTEL
review.reviewText: I pay for Breakfast included but they told me no. I pay AGAIN FOR ALL BREAKFAST. THIS IS NOT GOOD

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I was scared to leave my things in this hotel. We were treated nicely, but I don't think I will be staying here again. It was just for one evening. The receptionist was extremely rude when we got there. Other than that, we were treated pretty good. This probably was a really nice hotel in the 70's.

review.title: Bugs in the bed...
review.reviewText: Only a good location. I had the bad experience that some bugs in the bed itched me arms and face. There also mosquitos, and no air conditioned. I really never stayed in that hotel, the worst experience I had in vacation time. I could have asked for the money of return.

review.title: Worth the price, but don't expect much
review.reviewText: For the price and location, it was worth it. The staff were friendly and it was reasonably clean. But don't expect much in the way of hot water in the shower.

review.title: Good for cheap hotel
review.reviewText: No air conditioning, windows have no screens, small mesquitos got in with windows closed tight. Great location by park, great subway access, at net price of about $25 good value but won't stay there again.

review.title: Great location and price, but I don't recommend this place.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel several times because of the location and the reasonable pricing. I will no longer visit this hotel however. During my last stay in July 08, I needed help with the luggage, but the three men in the reception desk only watched me struggle. This also happened in April. Rooms on the lower floors and in the back of the hotel smell of sewer gas. I visited the hotel in July over a weekend. The tub remained blocked the four nights I stayed, even though I told the maid and the reception desk about the problem. I had a room on the 13th floor. The 12th floor is rented out to a religious group that began at 10AM on Sunday and continued unabated for 12 hours. The noise from the sound system could be heard as far down as the 8th floor.

review.title: I was really happy with the hotel
review.reviewText: I was really happy with the hotel. It is close to all major atractions you can walk to el socalo,bellas artes. staff was really friendly,rooms were cleaned. I will go back there if I ever go back to Mexico.

review.title: Love Mexico City
review.reviewText: The staff upon arrival were courteous and helpful. I suppose it was the porter who advised where to go and what was available in the way of tours. The hotel is located in an ideal location for tourists, close to the subway and attractions. This hotel would not be rated as a 5 star however for the price who needs more than comfort and friendly staff. This hotel also has a very nice dining area and offers buffet style meals on occasion.

review.title: Do not recommend
review.reviewText: The room that was assigned to me was an interior room and had no windows and no air conditioning. The beds were extremely uncomfortable, the bathroom shower not particularly clean. I would abssolutely not recommend this hotel.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Did not feel safe at all. Only a slide latch to lock the door. We put a chair under the door knob. The room smelled like smoke and it was very stuffy. No A/C or Fan. Too far from airport. Staff was accommodating.

review.title: good choice for budget travel.
review.reviewText: Great destination, good view, safe, nice service.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was very good for its price. There was no a/c, so take a fan! The hotel maids were very nice and my room was very well cleaned. Very convinient location, one block away from the metro which is very cheap! Great location!

review.title: Cozy Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed one night in Mexico City. The hotel seemed a bit far from the airport but it was well worth it. The staff was extremly friendly and the rooms were cozy & clean. There is a nice park 1 block away. I will definetly stay here again and would reccomemnd this to anyone.

review.title: Excellent for a low budget trip.
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best chioce for a low budget trip. It is in the cebter of the city every major attractions are within a walking distance. The hotel well serves its purpose in a "see everything" kind of trip. The staff is really nice, helpful and also speak english which is very unique in this city.

review.title: Decent cheap hotel
review.reviewText: Overall we were pleased with the hotel. The staff at the desk is friendly, but don't really speak English. This wasn't a problem with our party as there was a Spanish speaker who was able to handle all the arrangements for us. The rooms were nice, clean, beds were comfy. The TV didn't have a lot of channels, but we didn't go to Mexico to watch TV. There aren't a lot of amenities included in the room as one might expect in a hotel in the US - soap, shampoo and a towel, that was it. No wash cloth. However, this was all offset by the FANTASTIC location - just a half a block from the Alameda Central, and just around the corner from a luxury hotel that costs as much per night as our whole 10 day stay. I would certainly go back to this hotel, overall it was a very, very good value for the money. Oh, also, it is noisy during the day, but gets quiet at night, but I imagine that would be a problem at just about any hotel in the area.

review.title: Okay but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is okay considering the price. Just be sure that you do not have road work on the street because the windows are really thin and the works start at 7AM even on sundays...

review.title: The top floor have a good view
review.reviewText: First we got a room at 9th floor and it is smelly and no view. Next morning I asked for change another room. The staff change to topest floor and it has a nice view, clean with new renovation.

review.title: Great downtown location, very close to main square
review.reviewText: The hotel is very afordable,clean, comfortable and has all the necessary services, including speaking enough english to make your stay very pleasant.

review.title: Cost versus Benefit
review.reviewText: Some of the positives about this hotel is that it is one of the cheapest hotels in mexico city and the location is excellent in terms of being close to a great market- La Cuidadela, and near most of the historical landmarks in the city.(zocalo, plaza de major, templo major, alameda park. Negatives- very basic accomodations and very noisy- I heard car horns going off from 6am to past midnight, every night. This is not a hotel to select for quiet & comfort.

review.title: poor hotel but the employers is very friendly
review.reviewText: this is a normal hotel in the down town of the big city. the people is very friendly,so in me next stay i going to the other option

review.title: Very Good Hotel
review.reviewText: this is a hotel for anyone that just need a good room. it near all major site in the center of mexico city. there are majors place to get food. i enjoy it so much. i would love to come back to this hotel again.

review.title: Cheap and conveniently located, but by all means not a luxury hotel.
review.reviewText: My main gripe would be that the chamber maid didn't do a great job at cleaning the room. We also had to call the front desk twice because she failed to leave us any toilet paper. The power was out one night. And the phone lines were down the first night we arrived. There was an active construction site right next to the hotel. And it wasn't just being worked on during the day, but all night long also. It made it pretty hard to go to sleep. The walls are thin so you can hear everything going on in the halls. We hardly spent a significant amount of time in our room though -- it is conveniently located so that you are but a walking distance away from everything, so that kind of sort of outweighed all of these problems.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Close to the main attractions in the city. Very convenient.
